alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Ocean, northeastern Burlington and south central Monmouth Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wrightstown, or 17 miles southeast of Trenton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Jackson, Howell, Beachwood, Lakehurst, Pemberton, Farmingdale, Wrightstown, Leisure Village, Holiday City South, Pleasant Plains, Cedar Glen West, Jacksons Mills, Leisure Village East, Cassville, Vista Center, Woodruff, Holiday City-Berkeley and Cedar Glen Lakes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 22 and 31. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 81 and 92. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
